originalText.text: Today was my first visit to the Yard at Columbus Circle. Jane provided outstanding customer service. Effective communication and the response to my emails or phone calls were super fast. Thank you, the Yard! Dope spot for networking.

text.text: Today was my first visit to the Yard at Columbus Circle. Jane provided outstanding customer service. Effective communication and the response to my emails or phone calls were super fast. Thank you, the Yard! Dope spot for networking.

originalText.text:
Worked on the second floor. There are phone booths but were near upstairs construction and bathrooms so you could hear the noise. Lots of public seating as well. Location is easy to find and convenient.

WiFi was pretty fast and worked fine for video calls.

Friendly community manager. Would go again, perhaps trying the other floor if it’s available

originalText.text:
If there's a star below zero, that's exactly how I would rate. I decided to change my regular WeWork spaces and try something new. Bought the daily pass to check the place with a hope to spend a day working there and ultimately move to upgrading to their offices. Unfortunately my experience was a pure disaster. I walked in at 9:50am, left at 10:47am. The receptionist was rude and sarcastic, definitely felt unwelcomed from the moment I walked in. When I asked where can I sit she said "I placed you there", pointing to a few miserable chairs. I then asked her about other types of memberships such as dedicated desks and she had no clue about cost and what each entails (lockers, etc). Didn't even move from her chair, sitting all the time, definitely didn't even bother to show me around. She then told me that they have two other floors above and when I said I'll go to check those out, she said NO, I placed you here, again pointing to the miserable chairs. So I decided to give the benefit of the doubt and set on the "assigned" chair. Right next to me there was a woman who obviously came there to waste time chatting and laughing loud with her friends on zoom call telling them how she came in a cowering space to "get away from home" because they were installing oven and she didn't wanted to deal with that and left her husband deal with that, laughing like a lunatic. And here's me trying to do some work! I gave her a look few times with a hope that she'll figure out that this is not Starbucks and instead she continued to laugh even lauder. At the same time you have the receptionist giving an extremely welcome tour to a guy who she obviously found attractive and was hoping to get a date and literally showed him the entire place explaining in details what type of membership he can have. They ended up going on the other floors ... I guess he was "allowed and assigned", even tho he was only a walk-in (didn't even purchase a pass unlike me). I paid $35 (WeWork is $29 and can't even compare everything they offer to you for that price range. With an above and beyond customer service).
I left super fast and went across the street at WeWork. Miserable to the core.

originalText.text: The place is ok. The design looks a bit cheap. But maybe that is just my personal feeling.

text.text: The place is ok. The design looks a bit cheap. But maybe that is just my personal feeling.

originalText.text: It's been a rollercoaster. I started out in love with the space. Its modern, clean, quiet, and in a great location. That opinion changed when I moved to a different suite on a different floor in the same building. The main floor is very loud and often a mess. There have been ongoing maintenance issues that seem to pop up regularly, including an AC outage in July that kept my office between 80 and 90 degrees every day of the month. The only way I was able to resolve this was being lucky enough to have been waitlisted to another unit back on my original floor. Management offered no resolution to the AC issue, except for an apology. No discount, nothing. It's really unfortunate.

There have been ongoing maintenance issues that seem to pop up regularly, including an AC outage in July that kept my office between 80 and 90 degrees every day of the month. The only way I was able to resolve this was being lucky enough to have been waitlisted to another unit back on my original floor. Management offered no resolution to the AC issue, except for an apology. No discount, nothing. It's really unfortunate.
